content: this text is a summary of a legal case involving a datarelated issue the appellant filed an appeal to challenge a decision made by a lower court in favor of the respondent the appellant argued that the lower court made errors in its decision and requested the higher court to review the case the higher court reviewed the arguments and evidence presented by both parties and made a decision on the appeal the court either upheld the decision of the lower court or overturned it the courts decision on the appeal is final and cannot be further challenged the legal procedure in this case lasted until january 12 2022 the court used the marriage family relations act to make a decision regarding the division of assets between the plaintiff and defendant who are exspouses the court found that the defendant had a significantly higher income and therefore had a greater financial burden in paying for joint family expenses the court also considered the claimants contributions to raising and caring for the children and domestic work based on these factors and the relevant laws the courts decision was deemed correct the appeal in the case was dismissed upholding the judgment of the court of first instance the court case also involved the division of coowned property with the court of first instance determining that the applicant owned 75 of the property and the defendant owned 25 the defendants claim for a land registration document was dismissed and the defendant was ordered to pay the applicants costs the applicant appealed the decision claiming procedural errors and incorrect assessment of contributions the appeal argued for a reconsideration of the division of the property based on the contributions of both parties the court was asked to consider all relevant factors including income and contributions in determining the shares of the property the appeal concluded by asking the court to uphold the decision of the court of first instance

metadata.CASE_ID: Sodba Višjega sodišča v Ljubljani I Cp 1598/2021, 12. 1. 2022
